title: 104_hr3142
content: The Act is titled the "Uniformed Services Medicare Subvention Demonstration Project Act" and includes definitions for key terms. The Act, titled the "Uniformed Services Medicare Subvention Demonstration Project Act," defines key terms such as "medicare-eligible covered military beneficiary," "TRICARE program," and "military treatment facility." The Act defines key terms such as "military treatment facility" as a facility mentioned in section 1074(a) of title 10, United States Code. SEC. 3. ESTABLISHMENT. The Secretary of Defense and the Secretary of Health and Human Services will establish a demonstration project for the Department of Defense to receive reimbursement from the Medicare program for health services provided to certain Medicare-eligible covered military beneficiaries in geographic regions where the TRICARE program is implemented. The project will last for a maximum of 2 years, with reporting requirements. The Secretary of Defense and the Secretary of Health and Human Services will submit annual and final reports to Congress on the demonstration project for reimbursement from Medicare for health services provided to Medicare-eligible covered military beneficiaries. The reports will include the number of beneficiaries opting to participate in the project. The demonstration project established under this section aims to study the impact of easier access to the military treatment system on the number of Medicare-eligible covered military beneficiaries receiving health benefits through the Medicare program. It will also provide a list of primary health insurance plans and programs for these beneficiaries before their participation in the project. The demonstration project evaluates the impact of easier access to the military treatment system on Medicare-eligible covered military beneficiaries. It includes enrollment details, cost-shifting analysis, and accessibility effects on the military treatment system. The curr_chunk discusses the challenges faced by the Department of Defense in managing the demonstration project, as well as the effects on military treatment facility readiness and training. It also addresses the potential budget implications of making the project permanent. The curr_chunk focuses on the impact of the demonstration project on the military health care system budget and individual treatment facilities. It also considers the cost of prescription drugs to the Department of Defense and program beneficiaries. The curr_chunk focuses on reimbursement amounts. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will make monthly payments to the Department of Defense from the Federal Hospital Insurance Trust Fund and the Federal Supplementary Medical Insurance Trust Fund for medicare-eligible covered military beneficiaries enrolled in the TRICARE program. TRICARE Payments: Monthly payments made to DoD from Medicare Trust Funds for eligible military beneficiaries enrolled in TRICARE program. Payment amount based on beneficiary enrollment exceeding minimum threshold in operational regions. The amount of payment determined under this subsection is based on the average adjusted per capita cost for the year or an amount determined for services covered by part A of the Social Security Act. The payment is calculated using estimates of amounts for each health service provided during the month. The payment under subsection (a) is made to medicare-eligible covered military beneficiaries in a military treatment facility within the geographic region of the demonstration project. The Secretary of Defense and the Secretary of Health and Human Services estimate a minimum enrollment number of beneficiaries before establishing the project. The demonstration project requires eligible covered military beneficiaries to enroll in TRICARE program in each geographic region before the Department of Defense can receive payment. A minimum level of health services must be provided to Medicare-eligible beneficiaries through military treatment facilities in each region before payment is made. The Department of Defense may receive payment under subsection (a)(2) based on the determination of baseline costs by the Secretary of Defense and the Secretary of Health and Human Services. They establish the minimum enrollment number and level of health services to ensure equivalent projected expenditures for medicare-eligible covered military beneficiaries. Additionally, upper reimbursement limits are jointly established by both Secretaries. The Secretary of Defense establishes maximum number of medicare-eligible covered military beneficiaries and health services for payment. The TRICARE program enrollment fee is waived for individuals receiving reimbursement under subsection (b)(1). SEC. 5. MEDICARE SUBVENTION FUND. Established in the Treasury of the United States is the Medicare Subvention Fund, a revolving fund available to the Secretary of Defense to make payments to the Secretary of Health and Human Services for deposit into Trust Funds to cover additional costs resulting from a demonstration project. This fund also allows for the participation of medicare-eligible military beneficiaries beyond the maximum limit. The Medicare Subvention Fund covers military beneficiaries beyond the maximum limit for health services. It also allows for administrative expenses and other lawful purposes. The Secretary of Defense can limit enrollment if funds are inadequate. Authorization of appropriations is provided for fiscal years 1997 and 1998. Authorization of appropriations for fiscal years 1997 and 1998 from Department of Defense funds to the Fund for specified purposes, not affecting the Defense health affairs budget.
